user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_init_mem_pools_:
```c
void
MHD_init_mem_pools_ (void)
{
#ifdef MHD_SC_PAGESIZE
  long result;
  result = sysconf (MHD_SC_PAGESIZE);
  if (-1 != result)
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) result;
  else
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#elif defined(_WIN32)
  SYSTEM_INFO si;
  GetSystemInfo (&si);
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) si.dwPageSize;
#else
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#endif /* _WIN32 */
  mhd_assert (0 == (MHD_sys_page_size_ % ALIGN_SIZE));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_init_mem_pools_:
#define MHD_SC_PAGESIZE _SC_PAGE_SIZE
...
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_ _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code. I found no occurrences of extension constructs such as: GCC/Clang __attribute__ or __builtin_* identifiers, __asm or asm statements, statement-expressions ({ ... }) used as expressions, typeof, nested functions, Microsoft __declspec, __inline__/__forceinline compiler-only keywords, zero-length arrays as extension, or other vendor-specific language keywords. The code uses standard preprocessor conditionals, standard casts, standard operators, POSIX sysconf and Windows API calls (platform APIs — not language extensions), and ordinary macros. The preprocessor usage to select page-size macros and the use of identifiers beginning with an underscore are not compiler language extensions (identifier-reservation concerns are a different conformity issue). Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
